text: hi guys, im new here. im one of the guys who miss the “site tree” view on website tool. we are building very large sites and now is quite dificult not to break it. :disappointed:

Here's my workaround for it using <https://insomnia.rest> (can use others like postman if you wanted):

- Pull a list of pages with the HS API (you can use `property=field` to get certain fields when using the API - thanks <@U22PJPGK0> )
- Cleanup the format in Sublime Text
- Move this into excel (text to columns with comma separator)
- then sort it by the url column

Gives a nice spreadsheet for customers with a sorta site map feel. I suppose you could do some functions in excel and then a pivot table if needed to really jazz it up but that should suffice.
If anyone have a better way, please do share
If we could get "parent id" added as a json field for the nested pages, that could help build a site map or tree view a little easier
or even a module that can loop through pages like the blog content module does
thats a very “dev mode” to do it, but my clients arent.
